thread.title: Phorm raises £3.2m in placing and subscription
thread.title_full: Phorm raises £3.2m in placing and subscription

title: Phorm raises £3.2m in placing and subscription
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Aug 7, 2015, 17:30 BST - UK Markets closed Phorm raises £3.2m in placing and subscription By Michele Maatouk | Sharecast – 39 minutes ago Print 
  Phorm has raised £3.2m before expenses through the placing of 57.06m shares and a subscription for 7.4m, both priced at 5p per share. The closing mid-market price of the company's existing ordinary shares on 6 August was 6.25p and Phorm said it plans to use the proceeds for general working capital purposes. 
Following admission to trading on AIM, the placing shares will represent around 6.99% of the company's enlarged issued ordinary capital share. 
Phorm is an internet personalisation technology company. 
At 1418 BST, Phorm shares were down 0.8% at 6.20p. Follow the quotes you care about most. Access timely news and investment updates to stay on top of the market. … More » Yahoo UK & Ireland Finance Terms
